articles.headline: Charting test cheaters
articles.summary: An investigation into unusually high test scores at Wilmer Elementary in Texas reveals possible cheating by educators. The analysis shows that scores improved significantly compared to previous years, leading to suspicion of test manipulation.

articles.headline: Boat accident data sheds light on dangers
articles.summary: An examination of boating accidents on the Colorado River highlights an increase in alcohol-related incidents and hit-and-run accidents, with a focus on the tragic death of local teenagers.

articles.headline: Finding overlap in public-private interests
articles.summary: An exploration of how the private sector increasingly influences government operations, using case studies like Wisconsin's state government transportation contracts and their links to campaign contributions.

articles.headline: Uncovering bad bridges at risk in mudslides
articles.summary: A report on bridge safety in Ventura County reveals numerous structurally deficient bridges, some of which were severely damaged during mudslides, raising concerns about maintenance and public safety.

articles.headline: 911 data shows system's shortcomings
articles.summary: An investigation into the 911 response system in Broward County, Florida, uncovers significant delays in answering emergency calls, leading to reforms in call handling procedures and performance monitoring.
